com.isoterik.mgdx.input

Interface ITrigger

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GestureTrigger, KeyTrigger, TouchTrigger, Trigger

    public interface ITrigger
    The base interface for all triggers. A trigger uses an event data to determine when to fire. When a trigger fires, the InputManager invokes any InputListener associated with that trigger.
    See Also:
    Trigger, KeyTrigger, TouchTrigger, GestureTrigger

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isActive() 
      boolean isPolled() 
      ITrigger setActive(boolean active)
      Changes the state of this trigger
      ITrigger setPolled(boolean polled)
      Determines if this trigger is polled or not.

    • Method Detail

      • setActive

        ITrigger setActive(boolean active)
        Changes the state of this trigger
        Parameters:
        active - if true this trigger can be fired, otherwise it is disabled
        Returns:
        this instance for chaining

      • isActive

        boolean isActive()
        Returns:
        true if this trigger can be fired, false otherwise

      • setPolled

        ITrigger setPolled(boolean polled)
        Determines if this trigger is polled or not.
        Parameters:
        polled - if true this trigger will continue to fire as long as a certain event is occurring, else thr trigger will only be fire once when a certain event occurs
        Returns:
        this instance for chaining

      • isPolled

        boolean isPolled()
        Returns:
        true if this trigger is polled, false otherwise
